Definition of adequate progress should be reinstated. “Must” and “Should” should comply with case law and not mislead parents
EHC Plans should cover Universities and Apprenticeships and Student Finance England should accept EHC Plans.
Tribunal Appeal powers should be put back in the Education Act 1996. Mediation Certificates should be abolished.
Right of Appeal should be extended to Social Services. Parents in England should not have lesser rights than those in Scotland and Wales.
Currently no avenue for legitimate disagreement. A Right of Appeal is required for legitimate disagreement about amount of the budget.
EHC Plans should have a prescribed form so that they are the same for all children and young adults without local variation.
C & F Bill Right of Appeal after AR should require LA written decision within timescale & decision communicated to parents within timescale.

Proposals for reclassifying SEN to only cognitive impairment and to exclude therapy was not in Green Paper
Also means challenge to therapy provision cannot be made in SEN Tribunal for any child including those who are cognitively impaired
Cognitive impairment as SEN criteria will mean parents cannot challenge LAs at SEN Tribunals if provision insufficient for Aspergers etc
Does DFE left hand not know what right hand is doing? Is DFE split or do they hope that parents won’t understand “reclassification” of SEN?
